summary: Kentucky Fried Chicken - Kentucky Fried Chicken, commonly known as KFC, has a rich and flavorful history that began in the midst of the Great Depression. Founded by Colonel Harland Sanders in 1930, the story of KFC unfolds in the small town of Corbin, Kentucky, where Sanders perfected his signature blend of 11 herbs and spices. Initially operating a small roadside restaurant, Sanders gained acclaim for his mouthwatering fried chicken, attracting locals and travelers alike.
